summary: This is a discovery request letter from Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter requests preservation and production of documents related to the 2007 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) and communications between various U.S. Attorney's Offices, indicating Epstein's intent to file a motion to dismiss the indictment based on the NPA.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) Signed
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement was entered into between the Department of Justice and Jeffrey Epstein, which his defense now argues constitutes a global resolution of his then-existing offense conduct.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The Southern District of New York returned an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein (case No. 19-cr-00490), which is the subject of this discovery request.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team is preparing a motion to dismiss the indictment based on a 2007 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the DOJ, arguing it was a global resolution.
The defense is requesting extensive discovery, including communications between multiple U.S. Attorney's Offices (SDNY, SDFL, MDFL, NDGA) and Main Justice regarding Epstein and the NPA.

The letter suggests the defense will argue that actions by the Southern District of Florida and Northern District of Georgia regarding victims were inconsistent with the immunity commitments in the NPA.
The request seeks information from a wide range of federal, state, and local entities, including the FBI, SEC, DHS, NYPD, and the New Mexico Attorney General's Office.
